name: Andrew Ang
bio: Data analyst and engineer, experienced in applying data science to a variety of domains. I currently develop the research & analytics data infrastructure for Harvard's edX and Canvas courses.

I received my B.S.E. in Biomedical Engineering from Duke University, after attending Phillips Academy Andover. My current interests include data engineering and visualization technologies, Bayesian machine learning, and online education.

responsibilities: VPAL Research Group, Office of the Vice Provost for Advances in LearningDeveloping the research & analytics data infrastructure for Harvard's edX and Canvas courses.
Using data science to support strategic planning for type 1 diabetes research.Development of a data management platform for the Melton Lab beta cell production group.
Exploring relationships between trading, personality and physiology using real-time physiological data from financial traders. Research supervised by Andrew Lo.
Pre-clinical studies of PI3K inhibitors for cancer treatment.

educationExperience.activitiesAndSocieties: Duke Asian Students Association, Duke Squash, Rhythm & Blue, Scale and Coin

responsibilities: Assisting the Office of Alumni Engagement in event planning to connect and engage Andover alumni in the New England area.

unsupported: Machine learning, data science, web development, algorithmic trading with Quantopian, health wearables,
